Action.author: davidkel
Action.body: This kind of detection should be environment variable togglable as it would add unnecessary overhead and would be used as a way to determine problems in the field.

Action.author: harrisob@us.ibm.com
Action.body: This is not a SDK issue. The applications may check as many peers as they wish after submitting a transaction to be committed. The issues discussed must be handled by the backend.

Action.author: davidkel
Action.body: ~harrisob@us.ibm.com transaction commit handling is managed by fabric-network and isn't designed to go down to the peer level. This is something fabric-network would have to do, not the lower level api.

Action.author: harrisob@us.ibm.com
Action.body: I do not understand this request then, the only thing an application can do is check the endorsements it has before sending to be committed, which may or may not be from a peer that would have a commit issue. I just do not see what an application can do with the commit request to the orderer ?

Action.author: davidkel
Action.body: This suggestion was to detect where there was a possible state fork between peers. A commit event from the peer can come back as valid or invalid and invalid for a number of reasons. What if, when listening for commit events from these peers for the same transaction, they don't agree ? ie 1 peer says the tx is valid, 1 peer says the tx is not valid. What if all peers say the tx is not valid but the reasons they give differ ? In the past there has been the implied assumption that the peers will always agree when they validate and commit a block, but this has been proven to not be the case in practice and a fork in either the blockchain or state has occurred.

Action.author: harrisob@us.ibm.com
Action.body: Thanks, now I see what you mean. So this would take setting up and getting events from peers in different organizations, possible in all organizations on the channel. This seems to be an application in itself.

Action.author: davidkel
Action.body: withdrawing. If there is an interest then a new jira can be opened.
